stories.title: Should Social Justice Be Part of Math Education?

stories.text:
I have an idea that I think I invented. I wonder if I can make something of it.

Implementing it would involve some research, and quite large-scale transport engineering. It would also be likely to encounter political opposition in some places, but it would be environmentally clean, and I think it would be wildly popular.

This would be a long-term thing; I'm retired, I'm not up for trying to kick it off, let alone see it through.

I don't know if there is prior art.

How should I proceed?
stories.title: Ask HN: What should I do with a grand idea?
New facility producing lab-grown meat plans to produce 400k pounds per year
Oil well disguised as office building

stories.text: I want to start teaching my almost five year old son chess but it's kind of hard! Does anyone know of a simplified version of chess that might be a good first step in this direction? I'm think of something played on a smaller board or with simpler rules.
stories.title: Ask HN: Chess Variant for Toddlers?
Multidimensional manipulation of wave fields based on artificial microstructures
